question: How do I install and configure Xorg on Arch Linux?

golden_answer.summary: Install xorg-server and related packages, optionally install GPU drivers, create xinitrc, and use startx or a display manager.
steps: Install Xorg server: sudo pacman -S xorg-server xorg-xinit
Install video drivers (Intel example): sudo pacman -S xf86-video-intel
Or use generic modesetting driver (skip video driver package)
Install a window manager or desktop environment: sudo pacman -S i3 (example)
Or install a display manager: sudo pacman -S lightdm lightdm-gtk-greeter
Enable display manager: sudo systemctl enable lightdm
warnings: Choose correct video driver for your GPU (intel, nvidia, amd)
Modern systems often work well with modesetting driver (no xf86-video-* needed)
Don't install multiple display managers - use only one
Display manager should be enabled, not started manually
